intro: Quercus robur subsp. eurobur, commonly known as the European oak, is a deciduous tree native to Europe. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow or brown in autumn. The tree produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and has a sturdy, often sprawling trunk. The bark is thick and fissured, providing a rugged appearance that helps protect it from environmental stressors.
